title: Don't count invalid deposits
body:
## Description

Apparently, lighthouse counts deposits regardless of their validity. Don't count them unless they are valid.

## Version

`master` @ ddd63c0de146133ce7877bee218710a2b41defd8

## Present Behaviour

```
‚ùØ lighthouse bn --http \
--testnet-dir ~/.opt/goerli/witti/lighthouse \
--eth1-endpoint http://127.0.0.1:8545
```

The line `Minimum genesis deposit count met` indicates that the client might believe those deposits are all valid. However, it turns out that at least 32 are invalid: https://gist.github.com/ajsutton/8e03db5aea6e094d16333a7a0a0e5e39

I don't think you accept invalid deposits, it's probably just the counting happening before the validation.

## Expected Behaviour

Only count valid deposits.

## Steps to resolve

Yes.

This is addressed in #1103. From a logging perspective we have three stages:

### Waiting for more deposits

When we have less deposits than required validators, so it's impossible to trigger genesis.

```
May 25 16:02:29.783 INFO Waiting for more deposits           total_deposits: 8, min_genesis_active_validators: 60, service: beacon
```

### Waiting for more validators

We have enough deposits, but not enough of the deposits result in active validators.

```
May 25 16:02:29.783 INFO Waiting for more validators         active_validators: 59, total_deposits: 62, min_genesis_active_validator_count: 60, service: beacon
```

### Waiting for adequate eth1 timestamp

We have enough active validators but we haven't reached the minimum genesis time yet.

```
May 25 16:27:24.133 INFO Waiting for adequate eth1 timestamp     estimated_wait: 62-362 mins, service: beacon
```

Let me know if you see anything weird/lacking :)

Hey @paulhauner,

* Several statements are always getting printed twice.
* The _estimated wait_ seems off, the genesis time is correct though.

Thanks for the nits! I've removed the estimated wait time, it was proving tricky. I'm going to leave the duplicate logs for now, I'm trying to focus on core functionality and I'll come back for polish :)
